column2: I agree!
column44: Disney and Warner Brothers owe Johnny Depp a public apology
column51: Disney and Warner Brothers owe Johnny Depp a public apology
column52: Johnny Depp's win in his defamation case against Amber Heard shows that Disney and Warner Brothers relied on an outrageous web of LIES when they decided to strip Mr. Depp from his roles in the franchises Pirates of the Carribean, as Captain Jack Sparrow and Fantastic Beasts, as Gellert Grindelwald. The presumption of innocence is a right everyone should have. In other words: money should not be used as an excuse to tarnish one's life and reputation, because let's face it, firing Depp from the franchises was a business decision by the executives of each compagnies, a cold, shady, vicious one for that matter. As much as I'd love to see the World's most beloved pirate back to the screen in an eventual 6th installements of a franchise DEPP and ONLY DEPP carried to Mythical status, we ONLY demand that Disney issue a PUBLIC apology to the fan-favorite, well-loved actor. The same is true for Warner Brothers.
column54: Disney and Warner Brothers owe Johnny Depp a public apology
